title: Local shap on Isolation Forest
body:
Hello,
I am currently working on trying to use shap for local explanation of isolation forest.
I use Python 3.8.5
The code I have currently written to try and have the explanation of the prediction of a specific example (here the first one of our training dataset) is the following: 
> import shap
> from sklearn.ensemble import IsolationForest
>
> X, y = shap.datasets.boston()
> clf = IsolationForest().fit(X)
> explainer = shap.Explainer(clf)
> shap_values = explainer(X)
>
> shap.plots.waterfall(shap_values[0])

However I get the issue 

> Exception: waterfall_plot requires a scalar base_values of the model output as the first parameter, but you have passed an array as the first parameter! Try shap.waterfall_plot(explainer.base_values[0], values[0], X[0]) or for multi-output models try shap.waterfall_plot(explainer.base_values[0], values[0][0], X[0]).

I have dig into it and realize that shape_values.base_values is a 2 dimension array 
.base_values =
array([[11.96895553],
       [11.96895553], .....,
       [11.96895553],
       [11.96895553]])

While it should be a 1D array. I have currently tried replacing 
> shap_values.base_values =  shap_values.base_values[:,0]  
    
However I get the error :
> IndexError: too many indices for array

Would you have any idea of how to use local explanability method for isolation forest ?
Thanks a lot
